result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua H. Hoffman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Joshua H. Hoffman
Current: N2040 Hwy 12, Warrens, WI 54666 United States  (Effective: 04-05-2017)
Prior: W6628 Eidsmoe Rd, Black River Falls, WI 54615

Defendant appeared with counsel SPD William Poss.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  There is a joint agreement/recommendation for sentencing and the State has verbal authorization to dismiss and read-in Monroe County case 15CM54.  ADA Inlow states they have complied with victim notification.  15CM10 - Defendant pleads no contest to amended Count 2 (repeater removed); pleads no contest to Count 2 as written in 15CM48.  Court reviews charges/penalties/elements/verifies repeater status.  Reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights.  Court makes a finding that the defendant understands the proceedsing; freely, voluntarily, and intelligently enters his pleas and waives his rights.  Court accepts wavier of rights, his pleas, and finds a factual basis exists and finds the defendant guilty of the charges plead to.  Court orders 2 years probation for both cases concurrent with the following conditions:    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Must seek and maintain full-time employment which is deemed appropriate by your probation agent.  You must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.  Must participate in and successfully complete any recommended domestic violence programming and comply with any other recommendations of your agent.  Must work to attain a HSED or GED.  Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  The following are ordered dismissed and read-in:  14CM288, 15CM78, Count 1 in 15CM10, Count 1 in 15CM48, and Monroe County Case 15CM54.  DNA sample should already be on file - Judge ordered no surcharge be assessed.
No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with: Ashley L.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, with Attormey William Poss, specially.  Reading of complaint waived, defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by court.  Bond amended.  PTC & STC dates set.

Pre-trial conference at 04-22-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 05-11-2015 11:00 am.
No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with: Ashley L.
